conclusion: Analyze the motion of objects A and B before and after the string breaks.
Object A is at a height of 1m, Object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane, both have mass 1kg, inclined plane angle is 37 degrees, system is released from rest.
The only force acting on A is gravity, FA = 10 N.
Gravitational force component on B along the incline is 6 N.
Net force on the system is 4 N, total mass is 2 kg, acceleration is 2 m/s^2.
Time for A to hit the ground is 1 second.
Velocity of B at the moment A hits the ground is 2 m/s.
After the string breaks, B's acceleration down the incline is 6 m/s^2.
Time for B to stop is 1/3 seconds.
Distance traveled up the incline by B is 1/3 m.
